Title: Incipit with Illuminated Pieces
Medium: ink and pigments on tinted laid paper: cream for text area and rose or light brown for margins
Description: This illuminated incipit page from Walters manuscript W.657 has a headpiece in the form of a dome and 2 rectangular pieces below, one of which is a tailpiece for the end of Khamsah-i Amir Khusraw; the other has the inscription: Timurnamah-i Hatifi 'alayhi al-rahmah.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Book; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; India; Iran; History; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Mundir [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [seal impression with motton on fol. 280b]; Khwand Mulla Mahdi Sahhaf-i Tabrizi, Tabriz, 1295 AH/AD 1878 [mode of acquisition unknown] [note regarding re-binding and restoration of this volume by the bookbinder on front flyleaf iia]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Hatifi (Islamic, died 927 AH/AD 1520)
